title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message:
i've got this 820-2879 that was missing the lcd_ig_pwr__en coming from the u9000. i checked r9014 and it is good with 1kohm resistance with still no voltage going threw. Im guessing there is a problem with u1400 either not powering on or just not good anymore.

the other thing is when i plug in a usb optical mouse it doesn't turn the light on for it. so may be something going on with the processor?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: Does it chime? CPU Vcore present?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message:
CPU vcore is at 1.16v, not sure if it chimes being its out of the case right now. will see if it chimes in case and do pram reset. 

cpu vcore seems a little low but close.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: 1.15V is high for Vcore. A good board will start at 1.15 and then drop down to 0.99V. Connect a speaker and see if it chimes or beeps.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: no chime wouldn't reset the PRAM either, no beep, still at 1.16v.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: Beeps without RAM? Speaker in the case must be connected, not the one on the board.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: my bad just plugged in the case speaker and get beep without ram

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: Using known good PC8500 RAM? Try 1 slot at a time.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: so I'm measuring ppvcore_s0_cpu_reg at pin 2 at L7400. could it be that the q7401 is not working properly which is creating more voltage than its supposed to? or am i way off?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: i get bad ram beep out of bottom slot no video on top slot with no beep.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: That is SOS beep, your BIOS is corrupt. Got a donor 2879 board to pull a BIOS chip from?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: yes i do have a donor, you're talking about the u6100 spi rom chip right?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879 no lcd enable
message: Changed the u6100 chip and problems solved. thanks again duke.
